intro: Canthium sennii, commonly known as African senna, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It is often found in open woodlands and along riverbanks, thriving in well-drained soils. Canthium sennii is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional African medicine.
